org.apache.cxf.feature

Interface Feature

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractFeature, AbstractSwaggerFeature, BeanValidationFeature, BraveClientFeature, BraveFeature, CertConstraintsFeature, CircuitBreakerFailoverFeature, ClientBeanValidationFeature, ColocFeature, ConnectionFactoryFeature, FailoverFeature, FastInfosetFeature, GZIPFeature, HTraceFeature, HttpConduitFeature, HttpDestinationFeature, JAASAuthenticationFeature, JavascriptOptionsFeature, JAXRSBeanValidationFeature, JAXRSClientBeanValidationFeature, JMSConfigFeature, LoadDistributorFeature, LoggingFeature, LoggingFeature, MetricsFeature, PolicyEngineBPDefinitionParser.PolicyEngineConfig, ResponseTimeFeature, RMFeature, SchemaValidationFeature, SseFeature, StaxDataBindingFeature, StaxTransformFeature, Swagger2Feature, ThrottlingFeature, WrappedFeature, WSAddressingFeature, WSPolicyFeature, XSLTFeature

    public interface Feature
    A Feature is something that is able to customize a Server, Client, or Bus, typically adding capabilities. For instance, there may be a LoggingFeature which configures one of the above to log each of their messages.

    By default the initialize methods all delegate to initializeProvider(InterceptorProvider). If you're simply adding interceptors to a Server, Client, or Bus, this allows you to add them easily.
